description:
The anime centers around the titular Ekoda, who works various jobs, and explores the city nightlife. While she has a boyfriend, she is more into casual relationships than taking it seriously. She considers popular girls (which she labels "birds of prey") her natural enemy.

(Source: Anime News Network)

Note: Each episode features a different director, character designer, voice actors, and studio. Each episode is also split into different segments, with the first 3 and a half minutes of the animated show, followed by live-action interviews with the creators, and then showing the drawing of the short.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

name.native: コショージ メグミ

node.description:
[Website](https://takinamiyukari.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takinamiyukari) | [Blog](https://note.com/takinamiyukari)

She was born in Sapporo city​ but grew up in Kushiro. After graduating from Nihon University College of Arts, she made her debut in the 4th comic "Nearly Death !! Ekoda chan" depicting the 24-year-old freeters girls' daily life in 2004. Since then, she has developed a wide range of creative activities focusing on animes and essays. After living in Tokyo, she currently lives in Sapporo City.

(Source: takinamiyukari.com)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/長濱博史) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Nagahama)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akitaroh_le) | [Website](http://www5c.biglobe.ne.jp/~akitaroh/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大地丙太郎)

He is a Tokyo Polytechnic University graduate. Although Daichi was an aspiring stage photographer he instead joined animation photography company Tokyo Animation Film where he continued to work for 5 years, although he temporarily changed jobs and shot live-action karaoke videos instead. In 1991 he left his employer, worked at a game production for half a year, and returned to the animation industry where he would study under animation director [Tetsuo Yasumi](https://anilist.co/staff/111207/). Daichi would advance into episode direction and caught the eyes of [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/) and [Hiroaki Sakurai](https://anilist.co/staff/101153/) who were impressed with his work on [*Akazukin Chacha*](https://anilist.co/anime/103/Akazukin-Chacha). Daichi made his solo directorial debut in 1995 with [*Nurse Angel Ririka SOS*](https://anilist.co/anime/616/Nurse-Angel-Ririka-SOS). Since 2015 he serves as scriptwriter and director for [*Kodomo no Omocha*](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/Kodomo-no-Omocha/)'s stage version of which he directed the anime as well. Presently he's a freelance director.

**Style**
He specializes in high-tension comedy and often includes comedy and lighthearted moments even in more serious works. In his comedies he often smoothly deforms the characters far beyond their design, inspired by gag manga king [Fujio Akatsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/97141/). His directing work tends to include live-action images or brief flashbacks from past episodes. Since childhood Daichi became affected and inspired by the works of famous jidaigeki actor *Joushirou Konoe* inspiring him to make more historical samurai works.

Daichi is particular about choosing voice actors and has discovered several talents such as [Ayaka Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/95222/), [Nozomi Sasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95580/), and [Reiko Yasuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/95373/). 

**Accolades**
- [*Ojarumaru*](https://anilist.co/anime/4459/Ojarumaru) won the 1999 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Maksete Iruka!*](https://anilist.co/anime/2791/Makasete-Iruka/) won the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival Animation Excellence Award.
- [*Gyagu Manga Biyori*](https://anilist.co/anime/1196/Gyagu-Manga-Biyori) was recommended by the Japan Media Arts Festival Animation committee in 2005.

**Controversies**
In 2018 and 2019 voice actress [Hiroko Konishi](https://anilist.co/staff/96545/Hiroko-Konishi) alleged that she was propositioned by her manager to enter a mixed bath with Daichi in the nude and was blacklisted from the voice acting industry when she refused.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉井ギサブロー) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gisabur%C5%8D_Sugii)

Gisaburou Sugii is a Japanese anime director and Nihonga artist. He is perhaps most well-known for his work as a director on [Touch](https://anilist.co/anime/1065/), an anime adaptation of [Mitsuru Adachi](Mitsuru Adachi)'s manga series of the same name. Also noted for the [movie adaptation](https://anilist.co/anime/1961/) of the Arashi no Yoru ni children's book series, and the movie [Night on the Galactic Railroad](https://anilist.co/anime/1441/). He is a member of the Directors Guild of Japan and the Japanese Animation Creators Association.
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/yonetanikantoku)

Yoshitomo Yonetani was born  in Tokyo and graduated Tokyo Designer Gakuin. He is the leader of Studio 7 at Sunrise and was responsible for their super robot cult series Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar as well as Brigadoon and Betterman.

Yoshitomo was inspired working in the animation industry after having seen Mirai Shounen Conan.

He started as production assistent at Toei Douga, before moving to Shin-Ei Douga and finally Sunrise.

Other than anime director he is also a song writer for several anime series and sings anime themes under the name of ※-mai.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋良輔_(アニメ監督%29)

Originally from [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/). He is one of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most influential figures, pioneering and evolving the "real robot" genre of anime with shows such as [Taiyou no Kiba Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/) and [Soukou Kihei Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/).
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.
Akira Shigino is an anime director. He's a member of JAniCA.

__Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Blog](https://hh22.hatenablog.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dne_bu_hh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ひらさわひさよし)

Hisayoshi is a sound director and animation producer, and also the chairman of the animation studios [Creators in Pack](https://anilist.co/studio/6072) and [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/Passione).
Audio Highs is a Japanese music composer and arranger. They are mostly known for work in Gintama series as music creator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/osamukoba) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小林治_(イラストレーター%29) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Kobayashi_(illustrator%29)

Osamu Kobayashi was a Japanese director, animator, illustrator and designer, noted for having directed shows such as [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/), [Paradise Kiss](https://anilist.co/anime/322/) and [Someday's Dreamers II](https://anilist.co/anime/4483/). After graduating from high school, he worked as a mangaka and designer, but following his participation in the video game Grandia as a designer, he was mainly active in the field of animation.

Kobayashi passed away due to kidney cancer on April 17, 2021.

Brother of [Makoto Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/117729/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the 1945 born director, [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105374/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/osamukoba) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小林治_(イラストレーター%29) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Kobayashi_(illustrator%29)

_Note: Not to be confused with the 1945 born director, [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105374/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kojimorimoto) | [Website](http://www.kojimorimoto.com)

Fan of anime such as [Lupin the 3rd](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/Lupin-the-3rd/) and [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/Future-Boy-Conan/), after graduating from the Osaka Designers' college, he joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) and soon after Studio [Annapuru](https://anilist.co/studio/583/Annapuru). He wanted to work with esteemed Director [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/Osamu-Dezaki) since [Gamba's Adventure](https://anilist.co/anime/5267/Gambas-Adventure/) was particularly striking to him.

Interested in effects animation, he cites [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/Yoshinori-Kanada) and [Kazuhide Tomonaga](https://anilist.co/staff/110219/Kazuhide-Tomonaga) as major influences. He had his first breakthrough as animator on [Space Adventure Cobra](https://anilist.co/anime/2451/Space-Adventure-Cobra/) and [Golgo 13: The Professional](https://anilist.co/anime/1760/), in which his effects work and fun character animation was highly praised. Later his work became increasingly more experimental, combining his animation with intricate art design and CGI.

During his period at Annapuru he befriended [Takashi Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102031/Takashi-Nakamura) and the two worked on several projects together even after leaving the studio. [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872/Katsuhiro-Ootomo) recognized his talent and Morimoto became a key figure in many of his works. He debuted as Director on [Robot Carnival](https://anilist.co/anime/2182/Robot-Carnival/).

In 1985 he founded [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) alongside former Ghibli producer [Eiko Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103607/Tanaka-Eiko). He would later leave the studio in 2011.

Married to [Atsuko Fukushima](https://anilist.co/staff/118789/).
